description: This foundation-level studio course introduces the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical foundations
of three-dimensional art-making and the ways three-dimensional media inform the creation and
understanding of art in many contexts.  Students explore sculpture and its intersection with
other media and art forms through a variety of materials and experiments. The course
emphasizes idea generation. Students engage in spirited investigation, creative expression,
and play. Materials fee.  Offered each semester.
